climbs.name: Recycled Organic Free Range Sustainably Sourced Faux Jackalope Fur

content.description: This climbs through the right side of the small roof 10’ off the ground. There is a good hold above the roof to clip the first bolt from, but some may want to stickclip this one. Once clipped, figure out the tricky crux to get you to the second bolt. After you reach a ledge at half height, step right, and climb up a seam.
The first 2 bolts might feel a little scary, but there are bomber hidden holds to clip from if you find them. This has tricky and techy face climbing with a lot of options but all on small holds.
content.protection: 7 bolts, plus a 2-bolt anchor with rap rings.
content.location:
It is the leftmost of the three routes on the nice, clean face on this section of wall. Start behind some trees, just right of the crack that separate this wall from

Holy Moly...

. This is #2 on the topo.

climbs.name: Holy Moly, There’s a Roly Poly in My Guacamole

content.description: This is a fun route with a low crux and enjoyable climbing above. There’s some guano in the horizontal seam halfway up, but it’s easy to avoid. Continue with featured face climbing above the seam.
content.location: It is the furthest left route on NDNC Wall on a semi-detached pillar.

climbs.name: A Bag of Dicks without a Handle

content.description: Start on the left side of the small roof 10’ off the ground in the middle of this section of wall. Climb the cool arete feature to the crack through the roof. This first part is the crux and can be done in a variety of ways. Enjoy easier yet engaging climbing above.
